titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alfred Austin Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday December 18, 2018 at 04:01
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: Alfred Austin collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings and photographs by or about Alfred Austin. The correspondence consists of 14 letters from Austin to various people,and over 140 letters to Austin or his wife. The writings consist of holograph drafts, typescripts, and proofs of poems, playscripts, and notes by Austin. The photographs consist of portraits of Austin and views of his estate, Swinford.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Alfred Austin Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alfred Austin Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, this has been noted in the box-and-folder list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid encompasses accessions of materials pertaining to Alfred Austin.

Writings
"Achilles in Scyros"
2 typescripts, one with holograph corrections
Page proofs, with holograph corrections and additions
Progamme of Pastoral plays at Leighton House, where on Monday, July 19th, 1909 this masque was given

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A clipping from The Times , July 20, 1909 is laid in. Also laid in is the estimate from Macmillan & Co. for printing this work together with sample pages; and a memorandum from R & R Clark, ltd., of Edinburgh submitting fresh proof of title-sheet.

did.unittitle: "After Leonidas," autograph poem, 16 lines

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed on p. 20 of Lamia's Winter Quarters , London 1898.

did.unittitle: "Birthday Book," autograph [?] manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A work similar to "Days of the Year." On wrapping: "The H. L.'s Birthday Book (MS)."

did.unittitle: "A Border Burn," autograph draft of the poem printed in his A Tale of True Love
"Cassandra Speaks," autograph, with typescript, corrected

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph endorsed: "not needed;" typescript endorsed: "To be returned to me, when used for the purpose now sent. AA."

did.unittitle: "The Converson of Winckelmann," autograph draft of part of the poem

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Over the next to last page are approximately 4 stanzas of "John Everett Millais," a poem printed in the same volume. Laid in a folder marked "Winckelmann Right (?) Draft."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Poems, clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One poem, "The Evening Light," has corrections in Austin's hand.

did.unittitle: "The Poet's Diary," autograph manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the following note in Austin's hand: "Rejected by me from the MS of "The Poet's Diary," but proving useful elsewhere. April 3, 1904. Some of it perhaps to be used in the Diary. (see leaf 6 &c)."

did.unittitle: "Polyphemus," autograph manuscript, signed

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed in his A Tale of True Love , New York & London, 1902, p. 65-81.

did.unittitle: "Power," autograph manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Caption on the first leaf reads: "For "Power" Progress." (The word Power is crossed through in pencil).

did.unittitle: "Progess, A Comedy," autograph manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: "Sonnets and Lyrics unpublished and not yet written out 1908," autograph manuscripts
"A Successful Rehearsal," typescript, with autograph corrections

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laid in the manuscript are two letters from the International copyright bureau ltd., Oct 31, 1910, Sep 1912, regarding the placing of the play. On verso of first letter is a draft in pencil, signed, of Austin's reply.
